summary.purpose: Provides a reusable, styled HTML input component built with React.forwardRef, following the shadcn/ui design pattern with Tailwind CSS classes for consistent form input styling.
summary.problem_solved: Encapsulates standard HTML input element styling including focus states, file input styling, placeholder styling, and disabled states into a single reusable component that supports className merging via the cn utility.

external.reason: Core React library used for forwardRef and ComponentProps type

internal.why_used: Provides the cn utility for conditional className merging

details.what_it_does: Renders a styled HTML input element using React.forwardRef for ref access. Pre-applies Tailwind CSS classes for consistent styling including border, background, padding, shadow, focus states, file input styling, placeholder styling, and disabled states. Merges custom className prop with default styles using the cn() utility function.
details.rendered_ui_description: A rectangular input field with rounded corners (rounded-md), subtle border (border-input color), transparent background, padding, and shadow. On focus, displays a 1px ring outline in the ring color. For file inputs, styling applies to the file upload button. Placeholder text uses muted-foreground color. Disabled state reduces opacity to 50%.

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Trying to use Input without ref support
incorrect.why_incorrect: While the Input component accepts a ref via forwardRef, typing the ref incorrectly will cause TypeScript errors. Always use proper React hooks like useRef with correct typing: const ref = useRef<HTMLInputElement>(null).
